questions.question_text:
A consultant has successfully deployed Sales Cloud at Cloud Kicks.

What is the final step in completing an engagement?

discussion.content:
C
Hand over documentation is done during training. The question says "has successfully deployed" 
During a Salesforce implementation, documents are handed over during the following phases:
User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
After testing is complete, the client signs off on the UAT document, indicating that the system is ready for deployment. 
Admin training
The development team hands over documentation on the new system or feature to the person or team that will maintain it. 
User training
The Business Analyst or Project Owner delivers training to the users of the system. 
Train-the-Trainer
Super Users of the system are trained, and then they train their colleagues. 
Some best practices for Salesforce documentation include: Document early and often, Create a metadata and/or data dictionary, Map processes and custom functionality, Use a document management system, and Regularly audit documentation.

questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks' (CK) marketing department is migrating from its email campaign and management system to Salesforce. The marketing admin wants to ensure that CK’s email templates are retained.

Which two solutions should a consultant recommend for a successful migration? (Choose two.)

choices.A: The record owner, all members of the public group, a public group called ג€Sales team,ג€ and anyone above any group member in the role hierarchy will be able to access the three records.
choices.C: The record owner will be the only person who is able to access the account, contact, and opportunity records.
choices.B: The record owner, all members of the public group, and a group called ג€Sales teamג€ will be able to access the three records.
choices.D: The record owner and anyone above the record owner in the role hierarchy will be able to access the three records.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Public group will not have access to converted records which have private sharing model

D
B is incorrect. If a lead is shared with a group in Salesforce and then converted to an account, the group will not automatically retain access to the converted account unless specific sharing rules are set up to explicitly grant them access to the account object after conversion; the sharing settings are not automatically carried over from the lead to the account stage.

Selected Answer: D
"D" Ownership rules don't transfer.

D is correct: the default sharing setting for standard objects is always with grand access using hierarchies on. Also, lead might be shared with the public group, but after the conversion the objects are contact, opportunity and account and these objects are not shared with that group.
The correct answer is C with grant access using hierarchy not checked or D with grant access using hierarchy checked

Selected Answer: B
should be B

If the question had mentioned the "grant access using hierarchy" permission was enabled, then I can see why D was picked as the correct answer. But I believe the correct answer is B as it mentions the Sales Team Public . Would love feedback if you agree. Terrible question...
